To:Tom Emerson 

Thank you for the answer. 
I can't say that it thinks because it is poor at writing it though I 
can read English of a certain degree. 
Approve my sentence though it may be hard to understand. 

LINUX of Japanese edition can't do a key word reference and so on 
when EUC_JP and SHIFT_ JIS mix in the ARC file that crawl did a 
Japanese site with HERITRIX and which was completed and SHITF_ JIS 
is contained for its EUC_JP benefit. 

So, as a question asked to it last time, I want to unify Japanese 
inside ARC into EUC_JP.

I don't have skill though it seems that it can be done with 
java.nio.charset and ICU4J as having it told. 

Is such an option in HERITRIX though it is good if crawler keeps the 
page of the SHIFT_ JIS with EUC_JP if it is possible? 


I don't think that contents inside text/html will be indicated with 
a browser as a cash. There is no problem even if the page of the 
SHIFT_ JIS is kept with EUC_JP because it. 
It only wants to make SHIFT_ JIS EUC_JP because it wants to look up 
the contents of text/html with a key word. 


Thank you.


----------------
crawlerobo
